intro: Sebaea gibbosa, commonly known as the rough sebaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, orange-yellow flowers that are often borne in dense inflorescences. Sebaea gibbosa is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique appearance and resilience.
